image.altText: Alexandra Popp screams

items.synopsis: All four Group H teams remain in the hunt for a place in the FIFA Women's World Cup knockout rounds as South Korea and Germany meet in Brisbane and Morocco takes on Colombia in Perth. Follow live.

title.children: Germany at risk of World Cup elimination as Group H goes down to the wire

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: -by Briana Fiore in Perth Colombia has dominated possession in the first half with 51 per cent of the ball to Morocco’s 30 per cent. However, Colombia has failed to convert despite six attempts at goal. Despite less possession, Morocco has had more entries in the final third, 18, to Colombia’s seven. Colombian teen hero Linda Caicedo has been well-held by Moroccan defender Zineb Redouani on the wing. Caicedo has looked dangerous a couple of times with probing crosses in front of goal. They’ve provided her team with opportunities but the Colombians are yet to capitalise. At just 18, she’s still been exciting to watch. The mostly Colombian crowd has been extremely vocal. Chanting, singing, drumming and celebrations in the stand has created an electric atmosphere at Perth/Boorloo Rectangular Stadium tonight.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Half time: Morocco 1-0 Colombia

children.content: Colombia has dominated possession in the first half with 51 per cent of the ball to Morocco’s 30 per cent. However, Colombia has failed to convert despite six attempts at goal.
Despite less possession, Morocco has had more entries in the final third, 18, to Colombia’s seven.
Colombian teen hero Linda Caicedo has been well-held by Moroccan defender Zineb Redouani on the wing.
Caicedo has looked dangerous a couple of times with probing crosses in front of goal. They’ve provided her team with opportunities but the Colombians are yet to capitalise.
At just 18, she’s still been exciting to watch.
The mostly Colombian crowd has been extremely vocal. Chanting, singing, drumming and celebrations in the stand has created an electric atmosphere at Perth/Boorloo Rectangular Stadium tonight.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: It's been a tough battle, but Germany are back on level terms in Brisbane. They have had the majority of possession, and the majority of the territory. But South Korea's pressure has been stifling. It's hard to see how South Korea can keep that pressure going to that degree - but that being said, they've been superb so far. Germany will by buoyed by how they scored at the end of the half - but they will need more, because as things stand, the two-time champions will be going out.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Half time: South Korea 1-1 Germany

children.content: It's been a tough battle, but Germany are back on level terms in Brisbane.
They have had the majority of possession, and the majority of the territory.
But South Korea's pressure has been stifling. It's hard to see how South Korea can keep that pressure going to that degree - but that being said, they've been superb so far.
Germany will by buoyed by how they scored at the end of the half - but they will need more, because as things stand, the two-time champions will be going out.

items.synopsis: Abuse allegations against a childcare worker revealed by Operation Tenterfield this week compelled governments to do more to strengthen child protection, Child Safety Minister Craig Crawford says.

image.altText: Shane walks along carrying documents and wearing sunglasses.

items.synopsis: The board of inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann over the alleged rape of Brittany Higgins was sparked by allegations made by ACT Director of Public Prosecutions Shane Drumgold against police. But its final report has found those allegations were "incorrect" and "without any rational basis".
